title: How do I list a leased car in my chapter 7 bankruptcy petition. Think I list in sched G. But is it an assett? secured creditor?
question: I am just a bit confused on this issue. It would seem obvious if it were a financed car. I would list as a secured creditor and then list as an assett and exempt my small amount of equity.
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Secured debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
A leased car is a Schedule B asset as a leasehold, and and a Schedule G debt. Usually, the value of a leasehold interest is $0 unless someone would die to take over the lease!

Hope this perspective helps!

Leased vehicles are not secured debts. List the executory contract on schedule G, list whether you intend to assume or reject the lease on your statement of intentions, and list the monthly expense on your schedule J.

I strongly urge you to seek advice from a qualified bankruptcy attorney.
I agree with the first attorney answer - Schedule G, and make sure to file your statement of intention.

A leased car is an executory contract under Schedule G. You will list the lease there and you also have to fill out the Statement of Intention to signify if you will assume or reject the Lease.
You do not own any interest in the car so there would be no place for it on Schedule B or Schedule C. You would be allowed a car deduction on the Means Test for your payment.
